newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada operating profits rise 3.3 pct in Q1.
newsitem.headline: Canada operating profits rise 3.3 pct in Q1.

text.p: Canadian operating profits in the first quarter of 1997 increased 3.3 percent to a record C$25.5 billion, Statistics Canada said on Friday.
The increase came in the wake of a lull in profit growth in the previous quarter, the federal agency said.

StatsCan said exceptional gains in the motor vehicles, parts and accessories industry, spearheaded by strong domestic and foreign demand, dominated the 5.6 percent profit increase in the non-financial sector, where profits reached C$19.1 billion.
The financial industries did not fare as well, with profits falling 2.8 percent to C$6.4 billion from record levels in the fourth quarter of 1996.
Overall, profits were up in exactly half of the 30 industry groups, Statistics Canada said.
